DOC.brief_summary: Patients Submassive Pulmonary Embolism treat ultra-sound therapy improve right ventricular function 72 hour post treatment .
DOC.brief_title: Long Term Study Looking Effects Treating Submassive Pulmonary Embolism With Ultra-sound Accelerated Thrombolysis
DOC.criteria: Patients acute ( < = 14 day ) symptomatic pulmonary embolism CT Angiogram thorax embolus involve least one main low lobe pulmonary artery RV : LV ratio > 0.9 age > 80 Recent thrombolytic therapy ( 4 day ) Active bleed know bleed diathesis Known coagulopathy ( include treatment vitamin K antagonist ) INR > 3 and/or PTT > 50 Thrombocytopenia ( PLT cound < 100,000 ) History intracranial intraspinal surgery , trauma bleed Intracranial neoplasm , AVM , aneurysm Recent ( < 1 month ) GI bleed Recent ( < 3 month ) internal eye surgery hemorrhagic retinopathy Recent ( < 7 day ) major surgery , trauma , obstetrical delivery Renal insufficiency eGFR < 45 ml/min Known allergy , hypersensitivity , thrombocytopenia heparin tPA Hemodynamic instability define need cardiopulmonay resuscitation , Systolic BP > 90 mm Hg > 15 min need pressor agent maintain BP > 90 . Severe Hypertension ( sustain systolic > 180 mm Hg diastolic > 90 mm Hg . Pregnant patient know right left shunt Large ( > 10 mm ) intracardiac thrombus Use thrombolytic glycoprotein IIb/IIIa antangonists within 3 day inclusion . Life expectancy < 30 day
